intro: Pearsonia sessilifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its foliage is dense and evergreen, making it a hardy ornamental plant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
